title: BlackHatCoiner
author: BlackHatCoiner
content: I can launch a signature campaign, and manage it for you. - I'm a bitcointalk user since 2020, and haven't stopped being active for a week.- I know the business. What campaign managers do, how they do it etc.- I'm looking forward to cooperate with you. - I'm charging ridiculously low.No images, no colorized writeups, no significant effort to convince you I'm trustworthy. Everything done simply.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: It is excellent that we are getting a campaign manager like you who is an asset to the forum. Do you know how to create a signature? If not then have you contacted anyone who can create a signature? Before starting this service I think you should arrange it so that you can say everything clearly to your client.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: Jon_Hodl on December 06, 2022, 11:47:23 AMWhat exactly is a signature campaign?It's a campaign a company or an individual wants to launch, which pays forum users to advertise their service to their signature. If you have signatures enabled (which is the default option once you register), you can see that I have a signature under this post, which points to "ChipMixer". It indicates that I'm part of that signature campaign. Quote from: Jon_Hodl on December 06, 2022, 11:47:23 AMand what does a manager do? The manager takes care of the campaign. He ought to cautiously select the members of the campaign (according to their quality content, post count, merit count etc), check their posts weekly, update the spreadsheet accordingly-- generally, he's in charge of the service's in-forum advertising. Here's a list of signature campaigns that are run currently: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=615953.0
